title: Menagerie

Menagerie
Versions: 2
SMW Subobject for OutdoorIs variant of: Menagerie
SMW Subobject for IndoorIs variant of: Menagerie

The menagerie in a player-owned house is a room where pets can be stored, and various features to play with pets.

This room can be built either as an indoor or outdoor variant. Both versions require 37 Construction and cost 30,000 to build. Only one menagerie can be owned at a time, but it can be freely changed between the indoor or outdoor menageries. To do this, attempt to build the opposite menagerie as a new room on a door hotspot. The contents of the current menagerie will be moved while swapping the indoor or outdoor style.

Note: Attempting to switch between indoor and outdoor via the house viewer will only move the room, it will not change whether it is indoor or outdoor. It only changes when using a door hotspot.

Remember: Bring a saw and hammer!

There are 6 hotspots available:

  • Arena space
  • Habitat space
  • Pet feeder space
  • Pet house space
  • Pet list space
  • Scratching post space

Contents

  • 1 Arena
  • 2 Habitat
  • 3 Pet feeder
  • 4 Pet house
  • 5 Pet list
  • 6 Scratching post
  • 7 Changes

Arena[edit | edit source]

The arena serves as a way to have your pets "let off steam" by fighting each other. To use, simply use the desired pets on the arena. When two pets are placed inside, they will attack each other. This is simply for spectating as the pets placed inside can never kill each other. Most pets typically have special dialogue when fighting another pet, although a few use a generic set of dialogue.

Level Arena Materials Experience Cost
63 Simple arena Oak plank x2

83 Glorious arena Mahogany plank x2
Bolt of cloth
Rope 		299 5,215

Habitat[edit | edit source]

This space is only available in the outdoor version of the menagerie. These also require a hammer, saw, and watering can.

  • Note: The level boost from a cup of tea will work, but the crystal saw's boost will not work.
Level Habitat Materials[1] Experience Cost
37 Grassland habitat Bagged dead tree
Compost x2 		37 1,582
47 Forest habitat Bagged nice tree
Compost x3 		51 3,289
57 Desert habitat Bagged plant 1
Bucket of sand x5 		34 1,801
67 Polar habitat Oak plank x3
Water rune x2000
Ice cooler x5 		271 11,382
77 Volcanic habitat Granite (5kg) x5
Lava rune x100 		46 3,400
  1. ^ The grassland habitat, forest habitat, and desert habitat require a watering can with at least 1 dose.

Pet feeder[edit | edit source]

Pet feeders are cosmetic only and will not feed any pets within the house.

Level Pet feeder Materials Experience Cost
37 Oak feeder Oak plank x3
Bucket of milk 		182 1,421
48 Teak feeder Teak plank x3
Bucket of milk 		272 2,552
59 Mahogany feeder Mahogany plank x4
Bucket of milk
Gold leaf 		862 143,907

Pet house[edit | edit source]

Pet houses can store pets and extras (pet rock, fishbowl, cats, and hellcats).

Pet list[edit | edit source]

Level Pet list Materials Experience Cost
38 Pet list Oak plank x3
Bolt of cloth
Papyrus 		198 2,067

Scratching post[edit | edit source]

The scratching post can be used for your cats to play around. Alternatively, some pets possess special dialogue when they attempt to interact with it.

Rope 		124 987

Rope
Limestone brick 		304 4,451

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
17 January 2019
(update)

Olmlet pet variants now have the correct names and chatheads whilst stored in the menagerie of player-owned houses.
